info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 11:07PM CDT until June 01 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL FLOYD...MOTLEY...COTTLE AND NORTHEASTERN HALE COUNTIES... At 1107 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Aiken to near Swearingen, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Plainview, Floydada, Paducah, Matador, Lockney, Flomot, Cee Vee, South Plains, Aiken and Swearingen. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
